content.body: I think the powerful follow on is the decorated block

content.body: what the hell is going on there? we get `@@species` for the underlying ArrayBuffer, but then don't ever call `Construct` on it, instead only pulling the prototype off via `OrdinaryCreateFromConstructor`
content.formatted_body: what the hell is going on there? we get @@species for the underlying ArrayBuffer, but then don't ever call Construct on it, instead only pulling the prototype off via OrdinaryCreateFromConstructor

content.body: i don't remember the history here, but if that's not a bug, that's gotta be the worst usage of `@@species` in the spec

content.body: i will be so sad if someone is actually depending on that in a serious way
(by "that" I mean the use of species in TypedArrays and ArrayBuffers)
this definitely seems like a bug, though not one I'm inclined to try to fix
